meanings.sent1: The medicine helped in obtunding the pain after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: She used a soft tone to obtund the argument and avoid conflict.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie obtunded my worries for a while.
meanings.sent4: His kind words obtunded the sharp criticism I received.
meanings.sent5: The calming music obtunded my anxiety before the presentation.

meanings.definition: To dull or blunt the edge or point of.
meanings.sent1: The constant use of the knife obtunded its blade.
meanings.sent2: He carefully obtunded the pencil tip to avoid breaking it while drawing.
meanings.sent3: The rough stone obtunded the sharp chisel quickly.
meanings.sent4: The repeated impact obtunded the sharpness of the axe.
meanings.sent5: The file was used to obtund the sharp edges of the metal piece.
